meanings.definition: Most newsworthy or having the most news value.
meanings.sent1: The newsiest story of the day was about a lost puppy being found.
meanings.sent2: The newspaper always features the newsiest articles on the front page.
meanings.sent3: The newsiest part of the party was when the cake fell on the floor.
meanings.sent4: Her excitement was like the newsiest fireworks lighting up the sky.
meanings.sent5: The newsiest event in town was the grand opening of the new library.

meanings.definition: Superlative form of 'newsy', meaning full of news or information.
meanings.sent1: The newsiest website provides updates on current events every hour.
meanings.sent2: The library is the newsiest place in town with all the latest books and magazines.
meanings.sent3: His backpack was so newsiest, it seemed like he was carrying a mini newsroom.
meanings.sent4: The newsiest mind in the room belonged to the journalist who knew all the latest stories.
meanings.sent5: Her conversation was as newsiest as a live broadcast, covering every topic imaginable.
